Description: # bmw_cdapi
        
        [Connected Drive](https://www.bmw-connecteddrive.de/app/de/index.html#/portal) is a phantastic way to interact with your car and this library supports it. This is not an BMW product.
        
        api.py is a python script to talk to the BMW ConnectedDrive portal backend.
        
        It is heavily inspired from:
        https://github.com/jupe76/bmwcdapi
        
        The techniques to access the ConnectedDrive portal were taken from https://github.com/sergejmueller/battery.ebiene.de
        
        Regular Connected Drive login is necessary and you can only access your own car(s), of course.
        
        ### Prerequisites
        You'll need the credentials (username / password) for your ConnectedDrive login and the 17 chars long vehicle ident number (VIN) of your car.
        
        ### Installation
        ```bash
        pip install bmw_cdapi
        ```
        
        ### Authentication:
        You have two options for authentication:
        
        1. Set your credentials in a configuration YAML file and run:
        ```bash
        python api.py -c config.yaml [-p, -h, -a, -e cmd]
        ```
        2. Set your credentials as environment variables:
        ```bash
        export CD_BMW_USER='xxx'
        export CD_BMW_PASSWD='xxx'
        export CD_BMW_VIN='xxx'
        ```
        
        ### Usage
        Don't hammer the ConnectedDrive portal backend, keep request frequency low.
        For CLI output you have to specifiy the -p flag.
        ```bash
        # to get help
        python api.py -h
        
        # To list all available cars:
        python api.py -p show_cars
        
        # To list information per car:
        python bmw_cdapi/api.py -p query dynamic  # endpoints: dynamic|efficiency|navigation
        
        # To execute services:
        api.py -p exec_service horn
        ```
        ### TODO
        - format output
        - complete API
